ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 59
ygData.msgSnippet: ... If fishing poles are a part of the formula, it seems like you would use the string from the pole.  And yeah, what the hell is a spriket? Rotgut
ygData.messageBody:
At 07:57 AM 8/21/99 +0000, you wrote:
>

>There is 1 message in this issue.
>
> Topics in today's digest:
>
> 1. Some thoughts
> From: lukas@...
>
>
>___________________________________________________________________________
____
>___________________________________________________________________________
____
>
>Message: 1
> Date: Fri, 20 Aug 1999 18:36:51 -0700
> From: lukas@...
>Subject: Some thoughts
>
>
>Last night's attempts resulted in no luck again. I think we're right with
>the metal shaft and rod combos but we're missing something. Here's a few
>of my thoughts thus far:
>
>- Fletching strings or dwarven wire as a component seems unlikely.
>Although some items need things MADE by other trade skills (compass), I
>can't think of anything that requires you buy components from a different
>trade skill. Dwarven wire is for the Trueshot Bow quest (?) and takes a
>while to obtain - lots of travelling.
>
>- Spiderling silk sounds like a good possibility. Watch out though, there
>is SPIDER silk, and SPIDERLING silk. The latter seems more likely as
>spiderlings are right in Steamfont and it would be very similar to how the
>lockpicks need a rat ear.
>
>- Spriket? Assuming that the two books are all that exists of tinkering
>now, a spriket is the only item not used for any project. What is a
>spriket though? Not in the dictionary...
>
>- Raw bamboo doesn't seem like a likely component. It is a bard
>instrument, also the pic of the collapsible pole shows it constructed of
>metal.
>
>- A bottle as a possible component.
>
>
>Luke
>
>


If fishing poles are a part of the formula, it seems like you would use the
string from the pole. And yeah, what the hell is a spriket?

Rotgut
